text: In today's video,
I'm going to explain to you
how to get better at playing Apex Legends.
With these tips, you will be put

in the best position
possible to win fights
and become Apex champion.

Use our clickable sections
below to keep track

of what step you're on
during this tutorial.
Making conscious decisions,
like knowing the best place to land
when jumping out of the dropship,
when to jump into gunfights,
and when to disengage,

are all things that should
always be considered.
When landing, you'll want to think

about landing places
where other teams are not.
When jumping into gunfights,

you have to consciously weigh
the importance of the fight
and your probability of winning the match.
If you find yourself fighting a fight
that isn't going your way,

then disengaging should
be your first thought.

To learn more about how
to play Apex Legends,

check out our link in
the description below.
You have to know when to take fights
and understand when you have an advantage.

Knowing you have better
weapons, better armor,

or if you catch an enemy
split from their teammates

can all be advantages
to you and your team.

Better positioning, such
as having higher ground
or more cover compared to the enemy teams,

can also be an advantage
that should be considered.

If you find yourself at
a significant advantage,

then it may be worth
engaging in a gunfight.

Team coordination is the
key to success in Apex.
How you approach this all depends on
if you are playing with friends
or random players via solo queue.

With friends, it will be
ideal to discuss every choice,
from going to loot a certain area
or when to take shots at the enemy.
[gunshots]
Player: Oh, behind us!
Oh, I'm weak, bro.
I got to heal.
It's a whole new team pulling up, I think.

Narrator: Make sure
you encourage teammates
to do the same thing.
When playing with random players,
they may not be using a mic.

In this case, taking advantage
of the robust ping system
will be in your best interest.
On the other side,

make choices based off
of teammate callouts
or pings as well.

This will allow you to make
proper premeditated choices.
Aim is the primary staple in Apex Legends,
as it is for any first-person shooter.

On top of this, every
single weapon in the game
has a unique recoil pattern
that will need to be counterbalanced

with either your mouse
or right analog stick.

To figure out these patterns,
go to the training range,

shoot every single weapon
without attachments
and without counterbalancing,

then learn the pattern and
begin trying to mirror it.

For example, if the recoil
of a gun kicks up and left,
then pull it down and right

on the analog stick or mouse
when shooting that gun.
Once mastering this,

begin adding in a strafe
pattern left and right.
This will only make recoil control easier

and allow you to land more
shots on the opposition.
